articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Vehicles and Equipment to Chongjin Goat Farm
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Vehicles and Equipment to Chongjin Goat Farm

					Chongjin, November 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent vehicles and equipment to the Chongjin Goat Farm.
						 He gave field guidance to the farm in May last and advanced highly important tasks to be fulfilled in managing and operating it.
						
						 A meeting was held on the spot on Nov. 10 to convey the vehicles and equipment.
						
						 Present there were Hong Sok Hyong, chief secretary of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and employees of the farm.
						
						 Hong made a conveying address at the meeting which was followed by speeches.
						
						 Speakers said that the vehicles and equipment carry the warm love of Kim Jong Il, tender-hearted father who is taking pains to provide the people with much more various dairy products, and his trust and expectation that the employees of the farm would achieve greater success in the efforts to realize the intention of the Party.
						
						 They called upon all the employees of the farm to always cherish deep in mind Kim Jong Il's on-site instructions and his warm benevolence and bring about a great advance in goat breeding and output of dairy products, thus contributing to the improvement of the people's livelihood.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Iranian National Youth Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Iranian National Youth Delegation

					
						Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the National Youth Organization of Iran led by its Head Mohammad Javad Haji Ali Akbari, vice-president of Iran, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
						 The head noted that President Kim Il Sung performed great feats, paying the highest tribute to him.
						
						 He referred to the fact that the two countries standing in the anti-imperialist front are closely supporting and cooperating with each other in the international arenas.
						
						 He said that he would exert positive efforts to consolidate and develop the bilateral relations of friendship.

articles.title: Large Stone Coin Discovered
articles.content:
Large Stone Coin Discovered

					
						Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- An extra-large stone coin has of late been found in Munhwa-ri, Yonthan County, North Hwanghae Province.
						As for the stone coin, it was generally a parity thing which was used in commodity-money relations during the Bronze Age and the first half of ancient Korea. It has been known that the coin is a roundly trimmed flat stone 2-3cm thick and 40-50cm in diameter with a hole 6-8cm in diameter in the middle.
						
						Such relic is called stone coin because its shape looks like a coin and it is of greatly utility value in making such weapons and working tools as dagger, spear, arrowhead, scimitar, chisel and plane blade.
						
						The newly-discovered coin is greatest ever, with its diameter of 125 cm, the hole diameter of 22 cm and thickness of 12 cm. 
						
						There are more than fifty dolmen tombs belonging to the period of Tangun's Korea near the place where the stone coin was excavated. The fact bespeaks that it was made in the years of Tangun's Korea.
						
						The coin is of great significance in the study of socio-economic relations, commodity-money relations in particular, during Tangun's Korea.

articles.title: Mysterious "Snow-ice Caves" in Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Mysterious "Snow-ice Caves" in Mt. Paektu

					
						Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The Group of Comprehensive Exploration of Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu has recently found mysterious "snow-ice caves" in some deep valleys of Mt. Paektu.
						Members of the corps say the "snow-ice caves" are products of natural phenomenon peculiar to Mt. Paektu where winter lasts over 200 days with heavy snows, summer is short, temperature is low and wind is strong.
						
						With the advent of warm spring, thaw begins in the deep valleys of Mt. Paektu. The surface is heated by sunshine in daytime allowing the snow melt at the bottom and it freezes at night with the temperature falling below zero.
						
						The ice is different from the ordinary ice. It is a mixture of water from melted snow and pumice grain carried by wind blowing over snow.
						
						With the repetition of this process, the upper layer becomes hard "snow-ice" while streams are created at the bottom of the valleys by water from melted snow flowing down from the upper part and gathering from mountain ridges. By this water course the holes are steadily widened to bring caves into shape.
						
						In the meantime, the pumice grains carried by wind create a thick layer on the surface, which reduces the effect of solar radiation. This can be said to be the start of the formation of "snow-ice caves" in Mt. Paektu.
						
						When summer comes, with the rise of temperature, the snow piled up in valleys melts and flows down in earnest. With the repetition of this process, the width, height and depth of the caves increase to take on the full looks of caves. But, when the short summer passes and autumn comes, the ceilings of the caves, soaked in water during summer, get frozen again to become "snow-ice."
						
						When snow falls and temperature drops below zero in Mt. Paektu, the flow of water at the bottom completely stops and the snow-ice of ceilings gets harder to present grotesque patterns. The process is repeated every year.
						
						The steeper and the deeper the valley is, the faster the "snow-ice caves" take shape.
						
						Those caves look fantastic for the icicles from the ceilings, the ice columns standing up to the ceilings from the bottoms, the wonderful grooves on the bottoms and wavy patterns on the ceilings.

articles.title: Hoguk War Exercises Assailed
articles.content:
Hoguk War Exercises Assailed

					
						Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The Hoguk exercises staged by the south Korean puppet military together with the marines of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces with a total of more than 120,000-strong troops and huge modern war means involved were a dangerous DPRK-targeted saber-rattling aimed at mounting a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK and stifling it by force of arms, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a signed commentary.
						The Lee Myung Bak group is desperately stepping up military confrontation and the moves to provoke a war against the DPRK pursuant to its foolish ambition to invade the DPRK while negating the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, great programmes for independent reunification of the nation, the commentary notes, and goes on:
						
						The group is talking nonsense to give impression that it is interested in the development of the north-south relations and the peace of the country while paying lip-service to "dialogue" and "co-existence and co-prosperity". But in fact, it is working with bloodshot eyes to provoke a war against the DPRK while adamantly seeking to stifle the DPRK through confrontation and war.
						
						The inter-Korean relations have reached the worst crisis since the publication of the June 15 joint declaration due to the Lee group's traitorous and anti-reunification racket of confrontation.
						
						However, the puppet warmongers are conducting the large-scale Hoguk exercises simulating the invasion of the north in utter disregard of the destiny of the nation, thus revealing their bellicose design to escalate tension on the Korean Peninsula.
						
						No matter how desperately the puppet warmongers may conduct the large-scale war exercises with the backing of outsiders, the DPRK will never be taken aback by them as it demonstrates its invincible might thanks to the great Songun politics.
						
						The U.S. and the south Korean puppets should not run amuck, clearly understanding that the military provocation and the moves to launch a war of aggression against the DPRK will invite self-destruction.
						
						Only shameful defeat and death await those who pursue confrontation and war.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Anti-DPRK Racket Denounced
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Anti-DPRK Racket Denounced

					
						Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionary ruling forces are nowadays crying out for doing harm to the DPRK through "increased pressure" and "additional sanctions". This is, however, as foolish an act as trying to sweep the sea with a broom. Rodong Sinmun Monday observes this in a signed commentary.
						 The DPRK has built self-supporting national economy, remaining undeterred by Japan's persistent sanctions, and has successfully pushed forward socialist construction based on it, the commentary notes, and goes on:
						
						 It is foolish and ludicrous enough for Japan to think that the DPRK would not be able to stand on its feet without its "aid."
						
						 The DPRK does not care whether Japan puts pressure and applies sanctions against it. This is its stand. It has its own way of living. The DPRK will not be affected by any pressure or sanctions.
						
						 By "increasing pressure" and applying "additional sanctions" the Japanese reactionaries seek to fan up bitterness toward the DPRK among Japanese and satisfy their greed for power and, at the same time, torpedo the inter-governmental contact and negotiations between the DPRK and Japan and hamstring the implementation of the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration and the agreement adopted at the six-party talks.
						
						 Japan is persistently sticking to such a clumsy method to do harm to the DPRK, seized by a philistine-like way of thinking. A saying goes you scratch me and I will scratch you. The DPRK will counter Japan's measure for escalating pressure and sanctions with the toughest stand.
						
						 Japan would be well advised to behave with discretion, pondering over the grave consequences to be entailed by its anti-DPRK racket.

articles.title: Security Authorities' Suppression under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Security Authorities' Suppression under Fire in S. Korea

					
						Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The "Mirae" opera troupe under the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea protested against the puppet security authorities' suppression on Nov. 5.
						 The troupe recalled that the police authorities made an investigation into its members on charges of "formation of enemy-benefiting organization and admission to it" by dint of the "National Security Law" (NSL) on Nov. 4 and 5.
						
						During the investigation the police called into question the troupe's activities conducted in liaison with the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils and the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification which have been defined as "organizations benefiting the enemy". This is a trick designed to brand the troupe as an "enemy-benefiting organization", the troupe charged.
						
						The organization also bitterly condemned the Lee Myung Bak "government" for invoking the NSL to crack down on it for the reason that it gave its performances in the candlelight actions and created an opera on the theme of reunification.
						
						The organization declared that its members would wage one-man demonstration in front of the Anti-DPRK Section of the Police in protest against such unreasonable investigation.

articles.title: Joint Military Exercises Condemned in S. Korea
articles.content:
Joint Military Exercises Condemned in S. Korea

					
						Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Peace and reunification movement organizations in south Korea including the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration held the 201st Friday rally against the United States and war and for the withdrawal of the U.S. forces in Seoul on November 7.
						 A resolution was read out at the rally. The resolution denounced the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for staging the Hoguk joint military exercises, a dangerous war maneuvers aimed at invading the DPRK, in the sky, land and seas of south Korea.
						
						 It warned that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities should be keenly aware of the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by their moves for a war of aggression against the DPRK.
						
						 The peace and reunification movement organizations will join the people from all walks of life in bitterly condemning the above-said war moves and will wage a vigorous struggle to achieve the peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula, the resolution declared.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities' Suppression of Chongryon under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities' Suppression of Chongryon under Fire

					
						Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A meeting of Koreans in Tokyo took place at the Educational Hall of Japan in Tokyo on November 8 to denounce the Japanese authorities' illegal and politically-motivated suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and the Association of Korean Workers in Commerce.
						It was attended by Vice-Chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon Nam Sung U, officials of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon and the Association of Korean Workers in Commerce in Tokyo Metropolis and other Koreans. 
						
						Pak Chang Gil, chairman of the headquarters, in his report accused the Japanese government of making a surprise attack upon the Korean Hall in Sinjuku, Tokyo and searching offices at various units and confiscating files on Oct. 29 by mobilizing riot police and police investigation officers of the Public Security Department of the National Police Agency. 
						
						Policemen charged that the issue of income tax which they claimed left unpaid by a member of the above-said association though it had already been settled one and a half years ago is "a violation of the law on taxation" and raided office rooms of branches of Chongryon and the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan and the Korean Youth League which had no linkage with the case before taking away documents from there, he stated, and continued: 
						
						The reckless search operation conducted by the Japanese police authorities was unpardonable politically-motivated crackdown on Chongryon and the above-said association and unprecedented fascist tyranny. 
						
						Recalling that upon holding the post of deputy chief cabinet secretary, the chief of the Police Agency under the former regime who had been hell-bent on the suppression of Chongryon, held a "meeting of ministries and agencies concerned with the headquarters of measures for the settlement of the abduction issue" on the same day at which he instructed to crack down upon Chongryon as part of new measures against the DPRK, he noted: This self-exposes that the recent search operation was illegal suppression of Chongryon perpetrated in a premeditated manner to attain a very sinister political aim. 
						
						The report was followed by speeches at the meeting. 
						
						A letter of protest to the Japanese government and the police agency were adopted at the meeting. 
						
						A group of protesters made up of representatives of people of different circles was formed there.

articles.title: Laos-DPRK Friendship School Appears
articles.content:
Laos-DPRK Friendship School Appears

					
						Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A function of naming a senior middle school in Laos Laos-DPRK Friendship School took place in a district of Vientiane City on Oct. 31.
						Present there were figures of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, the Lao People's Revolutionary Youth Union, the Laos-Korea Friendship Association and the district office and teaching staff and students of the school.
						
						Present on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Laos and a friendship delegation of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries on a visit to Laos.
						
						The history of the school was introduced at the function before its name was announced.
						
						Speeches were made there.
						
						The vice-chairman of the friendship association said that the friendly relations between the two countries are deep-rooted relationship provided by Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung. He added that they would as ever consolidate and develop the traditional relations of friendship between the peoples of the two countries.
						
						The participants planted memorial trees after appreciating an art performance of students.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion irani
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion irani

					
						Pyongyang, 10 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio este lunes en un clima amistoso en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de la Organizacion Nacional de la Juventud de Iran encabezada por Mohammad Javad Haji Ali Akbari, vicepresidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran y presidente de esta entidad juvenil, quien le hizo una visita de cortesia.
						En la ocasion, el visitante dijo que rinde el maximo homenaje a Su Excelencia el Presidente Kim Il Sung destacando que este acumulo grandes hazanas.
						
						Subrayo que los dos paises en el mismo frente antiimperialista se apoyan y cooperan estrechamente en las escenas internacionales.
						
						Concluyo expresando la voluntad de esforzarse activamente por consolidar las relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena alboroto anti-RPDC de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena alboroto anti-RPDC de Japon

					
						Pyongyang, 10 de noviembre (ATCC) -- En los ultimos dias, las fuerzas reaccionarias en poder de Japon intentan atentar con el "fortalecimiento de la presion" o con la "sancion adicional" a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. Esto deviene un acto absurdo igual que agotar el oceano con cucharon.
						  Asi senala el periodico Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual del dia 10 y continua:
						
						  Pese a las persistentes sanciones de ese pais isleno la RPDC ha echado sin vacilacion la firme base de la economia nacional independiente y, a base de esta, ha impulsado exitosamente la construccion socialista.
						
						  Es muy ridiculo y absurdo el comportamiento de Japon que piensa como si Corea no pudiera vivir sin su "asistencia".
						
						  La RPDC no atribuye ningun significado a la presion y la sancion de Japon.
						
						  Ella tiene el modo de vida a la manera suya y el metodo de subsistencia. 
						
						   La presion y sancion no surtiran ningun efecto para la RPDC.
						
						  Los reaccionarios japoneses hablan del "fortalecimiento de presion" y la "sancion adicional" contra la RPDC para inculcar mas la hostilidad a la RPDC entre sus habitantes y satisfacer asi su ambicion de tomar el poder, por una parte y por la otra, tratan de interceptar el contacto y las negociaciones intergubernamentales entre Corea y Japon e impedir a toda costa la ejecucion de la Declaracion Corea-Japon de Pyongyang y el acuerdo de las conversaciones a 6 bandas. 
						
						  Japon, cautivado del modo de pensamiento del politiquero, sigue recurriendo a tales viles metodos y actua tan absurdamente para atentar a la RPDC.
						
						   La RPDC respondera con la sobredureza al fortalecimiento de la presion y sancion de Japon.
						
						  Este pais isleno debe actuar con prudencia reflexionando de las graves consecuencias que emanen de tal alboroto anti-RPDC.
